channel.title: Multiple Logins From ip
channel.description:
Helo i've got the whole 1 user per ip code
Here it is
[code] for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){ Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null && !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) && playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost") && !checkLog("connect", connectedFrom)){ sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected = true; return; } }
[/code] What do i change to make it 2 users per ip?
Help is appreciated Thanks

item.title: Multiple Logins From ip
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

Oh i see i thought it was 1 user per ip my bad

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Logins From ip
item.dc:creator: @Hellz_Scape Hellz Scape
item.description:
@Hellz_Scape wrote:

It means 1 person per a computer, not IP. Don’t change it, trust me.

Read full topic

item.title: Multiple Logins From ip
item.dc:creator: @Kalvin Kalvin
item.description:
@Kalvin wrote:

Helo i’ve got the whole 1 user per ip code

Here it is

			  for(int i = 0; i < server.playerHandler.players.length; i++){
			  Player p = server.playerHandler.players[i]; if(p != null &&
			  !p.disconnected && p.connectedFrom.equals(connectedFrom) &&
			  playerId != p.playerId && !connectedFrom.equals("localhost") && !checkLog("connect", connectedFrom)){
			  sM("Address in use!"); returnCode = 9; disconnected =
			  true; return; } }

What do i change to make it
2 users per ip?

Help is appreciated Thanks

Read full topic
